wikipedia_page.main: Fred Hartley (24 April 1906 – 24 December 1976) was an English cricketer active from 1923 to 1945 who played for Lancashire. He was born and died in Bacup. He appeared in two first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled slow left arm orthodox. He scored two runs and took one wickets.

response: Fred Hartley (1905–1980) was a Scottish pianist, conductor and composer of light music best known for his waltz Rouge et Noir. He sometimes composed music under the pseudonym Iris Taylor.Philip Scowcroft,76th Garland. Retrieved 17 September 2010

Hartley was born in Dundee in 1905, where he attended Harris Academy. He later attained a scholarship to the Royal Academy of Music. He made his first public broadcast as a solo pianist in 1925 and in 1931 went on to form his "Novelty Quintet", which regularly made broadcasts on the BBC. In 1946, he was made Head of BBC Light Music.Fred Hartley piano solos, Celtic Music. Retrieved 17 September 2010
Fred Hartley published several of his piano works under the name Iris Taylor: "Dreamy Afternoon", "Cuckoo in Love", "Twentieth Century Nocturne" and "Starry Night".
